title: The foreach Loop
text:
There is also a "for-each loop" (also known as ranged-based for loop), which is 
used exclusively to loop through elements in an array (or other data structures):
The following example outputs all elements in an array, using a "for-each loop":

Note: Don't worry if you don't understand the example above. You will learn more about arrays in the C++ Arrays chapter.
Good to know: The for-each loop was introduced in C++ version 11 (2011).

examples.heading: Syntax
examples.code:
for (type variableName : arrayName) {  // code block to be executed
  }

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
int myNumbers[5] = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50};for (int i : myNumbers) {  
  cout << i << "\n";}
